intro: Medinilla panayensis, commonly known as the Panay Medinilla, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
